metadata.synopsis: Laezel wants to talk about Orpheus

54.speaker: Narrator
54.text: *Your parasite communes with Lae'zel's. Her heart races as she learns of the events inside the Astral Prism.*
54.context: NodeContext: In a certain amount of awe.

9.speaker: Lae'zel
9.text: Orpheus - Gith's only son. He lives.

57.speaker: Lae'zel
57.text: Orpheus - Gith's only son. He lives.
57.context: NodeContext: In a certain amount of awe.

41.speaker: Lae'zel
41.text: It is not the ghaik visitor that Vlaakith would destroy and Voss would set free -
41.context: NodeContext: In a certain amount of awe.

71.speaker: Lae'zel
71.text: - it is Orpheus. The Blood of the Mother, the Prince of the Comet.
71.context: NodeContext: In a certain amount of awe.

40.speaker: Lae'zel
40.text: - it is Orpheus. The traitor prince, the lakzerai.
40.context:
NodeContext: lahk-zeh-rye (he who spurned his people)

In a certain amount of awe.

48.speaker: Player
48.text: Orpheus? The same one from the story?
48.context: NodeContext: Grounded, but with some worry. Orpheus in this path is a threat she wants to eliminate.

68.speaker: Lae'zel
68.text: Listen close - the Emperor spoke only in half-truths. For you to know the tale of Orpheus, you must know the tale of Gith, and of Vlaakith.
68.context: NodeContext: Grounded, but with some worry. Orpheus in this path is a threat she wants to eliminate.

38.speaker: Lae'zel
38.text: Long ago, when we rose up against our ghaik slavers, Mother Gith made for the Hells to secure an alliance with the archdevil Tiamat.
38.context: NodeContext: Grounded, but with some worry. Orpheus in this path is a threat she wants to eliminate.

44.speaker: Lae'zel
44.text: Tiamat gifted the githyanki our red dragons. Gith remained in the Hells and Tiamat's envoy proclaimed Vlaakith our ruler.
44.context: NodeContext: Grounded, but with some worry. Orpheus in this path is a threat she wants to eliminate.

65.speaker: Lae'zel
65.text: The first Vlaakith of many. It is Vlaakith One-Five-Seven whom my people now call 'queen'.
65.context: NodeContext: Grounded, but with some worry. Orpheus in this path is a threat she wants to eliminate.

7.speaker: Player
7.text: One-hundred fifty-seven? That's a lot of Vlaakiths.
7.context: NodeContext: Grounded, but with some worry. Orpheus in this path is a threat she wants to eliminate.

78.speaker: Lae'zel
78.text: Yes. Our current queen has claimed undeath and reigned for a thousand years.
78.context: NodeContext: Grounded, but with some worry. Orpheus in this path is a threat she wants to eliminate.

60.speaker: Lae'zel
60.text: But it was the first whom Orpheus tried to slay.
60.context: NodeContext: Grounded, but with some worry. Orpheus in this path is a threat she wants to eliminate.

34.speaker: Lae'zel
34.text: Orpheus was - is - Gith's only son. He led his mother's own honour guard in a coup against Vlaakith One.
34.context: NodeContext: Grounded, but with some worry. Orpheus in this path is a threat she wants to eliminate.

49.speaker: Lae'zel
49.text: Orpheus was - is - Gith's renegade spawn. A ghaik thrall who would return us to our slavers.
49.context: NodeContext: Grounded, but with some worry. Orpheus in this path is a threat she wants to eliminate.

1.speaker: Lae'zel
1.text: He convinced his own mother's honour guard to join a coup against Vlaakith One. He would have fed our empire to the illithids had he succeeded.
1.context: NodeContext: Grounded, but with some worry. Orpheus in this path is a threat she wants to eliminate.

74.speaker: Lae'zel
74.text: It was Kith'rak Voss himself who slayed the prince in vicious battle. Or so the varshes teach us.
74.context: NodeContext: Grounded, but with some awe. She respects Orpheus.

46.speaker: Lae'zel
46.text: Yet the Prince of the Comet's been with us, subdued by that repugnant illithid.
46.context: NodeContext: Grounded, but with some awe. She respects Orpheus.

58.speaker: Lae'zel
58.text: Should Orpheus go free, he would tear Vlaakith's empire to pieces and build new glory from the scraps.
58.context: NodeContext: Grounded, but with some awe. She respects Orpheus.

17.speaker: Lae'zel
17.text: Yet the traitor's with us, controlled by that repugnant illithid.
17.context: NodeContext: Grounded, but with some worry. Orpheus in this path is a threat she wants to eliminate.

27.speaker: Lae'zel
27.text: Should Orpheus go free, he would hand Vlaakith's dominion to his ghaik masters.
27.context: NodeContext: Grounded, but with some worry. Orpheus in this path is a threat she wants to eliminate.

37.speaker: Lae'zel
37.text: The Astral Plane would be first to fall. The others would soon follow.
37.context: NodeContext: Grounded, but with some worry. Orpheus in this path is a threat she wants to eliminate.

22.speaker: Player
22.context: NodeContext: Grounded, but with some awe. She respects Orpheus.

2.speaker: Lae'zel
2.text: We meet Voss in the city. And we obtain the key to freeing Orpheus from his prison.
2.context: NodeContext: Grounded, but with some awe. She respects Orpheus.

0.speaker: Lae'zel
0.text: We find the one Voss was meeting in the city. They hold the key to Orpheus' prison. It must be destroyed, and Voss' contact along with it.

55.speaker: Lae'zel
55.text: The prince is a ghaik puppet cloaked in githyanki skin, and the most powerful mind-master known to my people.

79.speaker: Lae'zel
79.text: We find a way to enter the Prism and slay Orpheus.

47.speaker: Player
47.text: Then Voss was right. Orpheus is the seed of Vlaakith's demise.
47.context: NodeContext: Grounded, but with some worry. Orpheus in this path is a threat she wants to eliminate.

14.speaker: Lae'zel
14.context: NodeContext: Grounded, but with some worry. Orpheus in this path is a threat she wants to eliminate.

61.speaker: Lae'zel
61.text: He is a ghaik puppet cloaked in githyanki skin, and the most powerful mind-master known to my people.
61.context: NodeContext: Grounded, but with some worry. Orpheus in this path is a threat she wants to eliminate.

70.speaker: Player
70.text: Orpheus wasn't killed, he was imprisoned. Can you trust your teachings?
70.context: NodeContext: Grounded, but with some awe. She respects Orpheus.

26.speaker: Lae'zel
26.text: 'Vlaakith'ka sivim hrath krash'ht. Only in Vlaakith may we find light.'

10.speaker: Lae'zel
10.text: This is the creed. I will not abandon all ten-thousand protocols over one sovereign secret.

86.speaker: Player
86.text: It's just one githyanki. Is he really all that dangerous to Vlaakith?
86.context: NodeContext: Grounded, but with some awe. She respects Orpheus.

24.speaker: Lae'zel
24.text: Orpheus is not just a githyanki. He is Mother Gith's blood.
24.context: NodeContext: Grounded, but with some awe. She respects Orpheus.

36.speaker: Lae'zel
36.text: Every word Voss spoke, he spoke true. Orpheus is the living proof of the queen's lies, and the living weapon that conquered our ghaik slavers.
36.context: NodeContext: Grounded, but with some awe. She respects Orpheus.

63.speaker: Lae'zel
63.text: One word from his lips, and the people would doubt. Two words, and they would rage. Three words, and they would bow to the True Heir.
63.context: NodeContext: Grounded, but with some awe. She respects Orpheus.

18.speaker: Lae'zel
18.text: If the githyanki are to be free, the Prince of the Comet must lead the way.
18.context: NodeContext: Grounded, but with some awe. She respects Orpheus.

20.speaker: Lae'zel
20.text: Orpheus is not githyanki. He is a ghaik puppet cloaked in githyanki skin, and the most powerful mind-master known to my people.
20.context: NodeContext: Grounded, but with some worry. Orpheus in this path is a threat she wants to eliminate.

21.speaker: Lae'zel
21.text: One word from his scheming lips, and the people would doubt. Two words, and they would rage. Three words, and they would bow to the False Prince.
21.context: NodeContext: Grounded, but with some worry. Orpheus in this path is a threat she wants to eliminate.

43.speaker: Lae'zel
43.text: The githyanki would be slaves once more - and one by one, the planes would fall to the ghaik.

4.speaker: Lae'zel
4.text: The Spirits of the Fallen, be my witness: I will find the means of reaching the prince through his domed prison.

30.speaker: Lae'zel
30.text: And when I return to the Astral Prism, I will slay him in the name of the undying Queen Vlaakith.

72.speaker: Player
72.text: Praise be to the lich queen. May her reign be eternal.

81.speaker: Lae'zel
81.text: Vlaakith'ka sivim hrath krash'ht. Only in Vlaakith may we find light.

53.speaker: Lae'zel
53.text: Our current Vlaakith has claimed undeath and reigned for a thousand years.

23.speaker: Player
23.text: Orpheus is a traitor? What did he do?

76.speaker: Lae'zel
76.text: He sought Vlaakith's head in a ghaik ploy for her throne.

69.speaker: Player
69.text: 'The Blood of the Mother'? Who is he, exactly?

28.speaker: Player
28.text: Orpheus? The very same who fought Vlaakith for the githyanki throne?

8.speaker: Player
8.text: A mighty powerful prince, if he can block out an illithid hivemind.

45.speaker: Lae'zel
45.text: And even more powerful still. It's said he could bring a thousand githyanki to their knees with one command.

31.speaker: Player
31.text: What makes Orpheus such a threat to Vlaakith?

39.speaker: Player
39.text: Our dream figure is a mind flayer. Isn't that more concerning?

67.speaker: Lae'zel
67.text: The illithid is a threat, make no mistake. But Orpheus is a greater one still.

29.speaker: Lae'zel
29.text: The Emperor, yes - a stunning revelation. But not so stunning as the prisoner.

62.speaker: Lae'zel
62.text: It is not the ghaik visitor that Vlaakith would destroy -
62.context: NodeContext: In a certain amount of awe.

83.speaker: Lae'zel
83.text: The Tainted Blood of the Mother. The traitor prince, the lakzerai.
83.context: NodeContext: In a certain amount of awe.
